text: Gonçalo Pereira Ribeiro Telles (24 May 1922 - 11 November 2020) was a Portuguese politician and landscape architect. He was born in Lisbon, Portugal. He was the Minister for Quality of Life from 1981 to 1983 during the António Ramalho Eanes presidency. He was the founder of the political parties People's Monarchist Party and Movimento Partido da Terra. Ribeiro Telles died on 11 November 2020 in Lisbon at the age of 98. ==References== ==Other websites== *biographical profile of Ribeiro Telles on monarchist website Realistas (Royalists) (Portuguese). title: Gonçalo Ribeiro Telles
